greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; and for n > 1, if A079559(n) = 1, then a(n) = 1 + a(A213714(n)-1), otherwise a(n) = a(A234017(n)).
comment: a(n) tells how many nonzero terms of A005187 are encountered when traversing toward the root of binary tree A233276, starting from the node containing n and before 1 is reached. This count includes both n (in case it is a term of A005187) but excludes the 1 and 0 at the root. See also comments in A257249, A256478 and A256991.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: a(1) = 0; and for n > 1, if A079559(n) = 1, then a(n) = 1 + a(A213714(n)-1), otherwise a(n) = a(A234017(n)).
a(n) = A080791(A233275(n)). [Number of nonleading zeros in the binary representation of A233275(n).]
program: (Scheme, alternative definitions, the first one utilizing memoizing definec-macro)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 19 2015
